title: How to Go Through a Video Frame by Frame in VLC

steps.title: Open a video in VLC.
steps.content: Open a video in VLC. Open VLC Media Player, then select Media > Open File and locate the video file you want to go through frame by frame. VLC supports several video file formats, including AVI, WMA, MP4, MOV, WAV (including DTS), and more. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Play the video or clip.
steps.content: Play the video or clip. You can go back to the beginning any time to view the frames there, but you must first start playing the video before VLC can understand that you are trying to go through it frame by frame.

steps.title: Click E to go frame by frame.
steps.content: Click E to go frame by frame. The E key is the default VLC hotkey for going frame by frame. Clicking it will cause a video to progress by a single frame. Continue tapping it to keep going through each frame. [2] X Research source Users can change the frame-by-frame hotkey by navigating to Tools > Preferences > Hotkeys , clicking on Next frame and pressing the desired key on their keyboard. Go backwards to a previous frame by clicking Ctrl + T to rewind by a second or two, and then use the hotkey to continue progressing frame by frame.

steps.title: Add the frame-by-frame button to your VLC toolbar.
steps.content: Add the frame-by-frame button to your VLC toolbar. Open VLC Media Player and navigate to Tools > Customize interface . Then, scroll down to Toolbar Elements and locate the Frame by Frame option. It is represented by a play icon with a bar to its left. Click and drag the icon to your desired location for it. Windows users can more quickly add this button to their display by clicking View and selecting Advanced Controls . The button will then appear at the bottom of their player interface. VLC Media Player on macOS does not include the "Advanced Controls" option. Consider placing the frame-by-frame icon in "Line 2" of the main toolbar, so you can easily access it during playback. Your VLC Media Player may already display this frame-by-frame icon by default in its toolbar. Keep an eye out for it before adding it manually.

steps.title: Open a video in VLC.
steps.content: Open a video in VLC. Select Media > Open File and locate the video file you want to go through frame by frame. VLC supports several video file formats, including AVI, WMA, MP4, MOV, WAV (including DTS), and more.

steps.title: Press the frame-by-frame button.
steps.content: Press the frame-by-frame button. Continually press your newly added icon to move though your video file frame by frame. [3] X Research source
